net.randomsync.testng.excel
Class ExcelSuiteParser

java.lang.Object
  net.randomsync.testng.excel.ExcelSuiteParser
All Implemented Interfaces:
net.randomsync.testng.excel.IExcelFileParser
public class ExcelSuiteParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements net.randomsync.testng.excel.IExcelFileParser

The default parser used by ExcelTestNGRunner to parse an Excel file into TestNG XmlSuites. It parses each worksheet into a separate suite and returns a list of all parsed XmlSuites

This parser can be customized by using a custom parserMap, which specifies where to find the Suite and Test data. ParserMapConstants is used to specify the keys of the map

Author:
Gaurav Gupta

public ExcelSuiteParser()

public ExcelSuiteParser(java.util.Map<net.randomsync.testng.excel.ParserMapConstants,int[]> parserMap)

Parameters:
parserMap - custom parser map to specify the location of suite/test data
Method Detail

setParserMap

public void setParserMap(java.util.Map<net.randomsync.testng.excel.ParserMapConstants,int[]> parserMap)
Set the parser map for this parser. This can be used to customize the location of suite/test data that the parser retrieves from Excel files.

Parameters:
parserMap - Map that will be used to parse Excel file(s)

getXmlSuites

public java.util.List<org.testng.xml.XmlSuite> getXmlSuites(java.io.File file,
                                                            boolean loadClasses)
                                                     throws org.apache.poi.openxml4j.exceptions.InvalidFormatException,
                                                            java.io.IOException
Parses the Excel file and returns a list of TestNG XmlSuites. If there are multiple worksheets, each worksheet is parsed into a separate XmlSuite

Specified by:
getXmlSuites in interface net.randomsync.testng.excel.IExcelFileParser
Parameters:
file - source Excel file
loadClasses - whether to load test classes
Returns:
a List of TestNG XmlSuite with all tests from the Excel file
Throws:
java.io.IOException
org.apache.poi.openxml4j.exceptions.InvalidFormatException

parseExcelTestCases

public java.util.List<net.randomsync.testng.excel.ExcelTestCase> parseExcelTestCases(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Sheet sheet)
Parses the worksheet starting with header row and returns a list of test cases. Each row is considered as a test case with specific columns (specified by parserMap) as test data. If there's an error parsing any row, it is skipped.

Returns:
a list of test cases in the worksheet

getSuiteName

public java.lang.String getSuiteName(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Sheet sheet)
Returns the name of the Suite from the worksheet. If unable to find the suite name (for example, if the location is invalid), an empty string is returned

If a custom parser map is defined, the value is returned from the cell pointed at by the appropriate key. If a custom map is not defined or if it doesn't contain the appropriate key, it returns the value from the cell adjacent to a cell containing SUITE_NAME_STR.

Parameters:
sheet - The worksheet to be parsed
Returns:
Name of the Suite or blank string if not found

getSuiteParams

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getSuiteParams(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Sheet sheet)
Returns the Suite parameters from the worksheet as a Map. The suite parameters are required to be in a single cell in java Properties format. If the parameters are not found or are invalid, an empty map is returned.

If a custom parser map is defined, the parameters map is returned from the cell pointed at by the appropriate key. If a custom map is not defined or if it doesn't contain the appropriate key, it returns the map from the cell adjacent to a cell containing SUITE_PARAMS_STR.

Parameters:
sheet - The worksheet to be parsed
Returns:
A map containing the suite parameters

getHeaderRow

public int getHeaderRow(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Sheet sheet,
                        int testIdCol)
Returns the header row location from the worksheet. Header row is the row that contains headers for test specifications and below which, all rows are required to be test case specifications.

To find the header row, first the location of Test Id column should be determined using getTestIdCol(Sheet). The header row is the first row that contains TEST_ID_STR in that column.

Parameters:
sheet - The worksheet to be parsed
testIdCol - The column containing the Test Id (0-based)
Returns:
the location of header row, or 0 if not found

getTestIdCol

public int getTestIdCol(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Sheet sheet)
Returns the location of Test Id column from the worksheet. If a custom parser map is defined correctly, the value of TEST_ID_COL is returned. If not, it defaults to 0.

Parameters:
sheet - worksheet to be parsed
Returns:
the location of Test Id column, or 0 if not found
